title: Turkey's Erdogan says hopes Syria's Afrin town to be captured by Wednesday evening
text: March 14, 2018 / 9:53 AM / Updated 7 hours ago Turkey's Erdogan says hopes Syria's Afrin town to be captured by Wednesday evening Reuters Staff 1 Min Read ANKARA (Reuters) - President Tayyip Erdogan said he hoped Turkeyâ€™s military and its rebel allies would completely capture the northern Syrian town of Afrin by Wednesday evening, a day after the armed forces said it had encircled the town. Turkish-backed Free Syrian Army fighters are seen in Maryamayn in eastern Afrin, Syria March 11, 2018. REUTERS/Khalil Ashawi Speaking to local administrators in Ankara, Erdogan also said civilians in Afrin town were being evacuated in cars through a special corridor, as Turkish forces made substantial advances against Kurdish fighters in their nearly two-month-old offensive. Reporting by Tuvan Gumrukcu and Ece Toksabay; Editing by David Dolan
